label: Control
comment: Trustworthiness of the actor or process managing a host (including control over access to the host) while it is connected to the system and fulfilling its system role (i.e. in some context).

label: ExploitTW
comment: Free of software vulnerabilities that are accessible to attackers.

label: User TW
comment: Trustworthiness of users with access to the shell or having the rights of a process on a host while the host is connected to the system and fulfilling its system role (i.e. in some context).

label: Authenticity
comment: The data (which may be embedded in an IoT device) is what it claims to be, i.e. it is neither forged nor altered in a way designed to induce false behaviour in other assets consuming the data.

label: Confidentiality
comment: Signifies that data (which may be embedded in an IoT device) is only accessible to authorised users.

label: Integrity
comment: The data (which may be embedded in an IoT device) is correct and fit for purpose.

label: Timeliness
comment: Represents a state in which a data asset is up to date, or a process or human has up to date inputs.

label: DefaultTW
comment: Modelling artefact: an attribute that is always set to the lowest trustworthiness level, and used as a cause for threats that are triggered entirely by the use of security controls.

label: Decrypted
comment: An attribute of stored or flowing copies of data, signifying that the data is accessible in unencrypted form. Considered a trustworthiness attribute as it precludes loss of availability where a process lacks a suitable decryption key, and used to model side effects of encryption controls.

label: Encrypted
comment: An attribute of stored or flowing copies of data, signifying that the data is accessible in encrypted form. Considered a trustworthiness attribute as it prevents loss of confidentiality unless the key is compromised, and used to model side effects of encryption controls.

label: Capacity
comment: Represents the total capacity at a Data Centre, or more accurately, the level of trust that it will be able to handle any demand placed on it by automatically provisioned for hosts and processes.

label: ExtrinsicTW
comment: Free of software vulnerabilities in processes and devices that are likely to be discovered by potential attackers.

label: Health
comment: Free of self-propagating malware.

label: IntrinsicTW
comment: Free of functional software bugs that cause errors or crashes without external provocation.

label: NetworkControl
comment: Control over routing within an abstract or logical subnet.

label: NetworkUserTW
comment: Trustworthiness of users with access to an abstract or logical network subnet.

label: OutOfService
comment: The asset is not currently engaged or being used within the system, and hence cannot be exploited by attackers.

label: ResourceTW
comment: Provisining is controlled by a trustworthy process or administrator.

label: BackdoorTW
comment: The host has no back doors inserted into its operating system or other software running on the host. If back doors are present, this also makes processes running on the host vulnerable.

label: Underload
comment: Represents the spare capacity at a Data Centre.

label: BandwidthManaged
comment: Signifies that bandwidth used by message flows through an interface can be restricted based on their source and/or destination addresses.

label: CommsNotSnoopable
comment: Applies to a network or a communication channel between processes, signifying that messages cannot be intercepted and read in that network or channel.

label: ConnectionsBlocked
comment: Applies to a communication route, i.e. the Interface between a Host and a Subnet, or a Logical Segment representing a route between two Subnets, signifying that by default, messages will be dropped.

label: NetworkAuthenticity
comment: The connection from a supplicant device is not an imposter subnet.

label: OccupantTW
comment: Trustworthiness of users with physical access to a space.

label: PhysicalControl
comment: Control over the means of access to a space.

label: AnonUserTW
comment: Only trustworthy users can send requests to a service via a reverse proxy that forwards everything including authentication attempts to the back end service. As far as the proxy is concerned, the user is anonymous, so this attribute relates to how accessible the proxy is to potential attackers.

label: ClientAuthenticity
comment: The client accessing a service has a reliable means of preventing impersonation.

label: ClientTW
comment: The client accessing a service is not controlled by a malicious actor.

label: ProxyUserTW
comment: Only trustworthy users can send requests to a service via a reverse proxy. In this case the proxy authenticates users, so trustworthiness would only be eroded if this authentication failed.

label: ServiceAuthenticity
comment: The service accessed by a client is not an imposter.

label: ServiceChannelsBlocked
comment: Applies to a communication route, i.e. the Interface between a Host and a Subnet, or a Logical Segment representing a route between two Subnets. Signifies that no exceptions were created to allow client-service connections and messages to tunnel through a default deny routing policy.

label: ServiceTW
comment: The service accessed by a client is not controlled by a malicious actor.

label: OwnerControl
comment: A device or a process running on the device is still controlled by a trustworthy actor or process in some context after the device has been stolen by an attacker.

label: Possession
comment: Attribute signifying that a (mobile) device is in the hands of the right user.

label: Astuteness
comment: The ability to detect attempts by other agents to induce inappropriate action through deception.

label: Availability
comment: The asset is able to carry out its function within the system, including being accessible by other assets that need to interact with it.

label: Benevolence
comment: Free of malicious motives or desires to cause adverse effects without external provocation.

label: Competence
comment: Ability to carry out reliably the functions of a user role within the system.

label: Reliability
comment: Means the asset will perform tasks correctly, with no functional errors, assuming the asset is not supplied with corrupt or inaccurate information as input (in the case of Human or Process assets).

label: Trust
comment: Propensity of a Stakeholder (usually a Human) to engage with and fulfil their role in a system.

label: Extrinsic-A-TW
comment: Free of software vulnerabilities whose exploitation would compromise asset availability.

label: Extrinsic-AU-TW
comment: Free of software vulnerabilities that allow authentication to be bypassed.

label: Extrinsic-C-TW
comment: Free of software vulnerabilities whose exploitation would compromise confidentiality.

label: Extrinsic-I-TW
comment: Free of software vulnerabilities whose exploitation would compromise integrity or authenticity of data.

label: Extrinsic-M-TW
comment: Free of software vulnerabilities whose exploitation would allow an attacker to take control.

label: Extrinsic-QI-TW
comment: Free of software vulnerabilities that allow injection of queries into a trusting back-end process.

label: Extrinsic-U-TW
comment: Free of software vulnerabilities whose exploitation would allow an attacker user level access.

label: Extrinsic-VA-TW
comment: Free of software vulnerabilities that can be accessed from the local network.

label: Extrinsic-VL-TW
comment: Free of software vulnerabilities that can be accessed from a local shell or via physical access.

label: Extrinsic-VN-TW
comment: Free of software vulnerabilities that can be accessed from a remote network.

label: Extrinsic-W-TW
comment: Free of software vulnerabilities whose exploitation would allow insertion of self-propagating malware.

label: Extrinsic-XS-TW
comment: Free of software vulnerabilities that allow injection of malicious scripts into a client process.
